snippet: The British prime minister revealed new proposals that could restrict the activities of those thought to be radicalizing people and close buildings being used to promote jihad.
abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron pledges to seek new powers to combat radicalization of Muslims and end what he labels passive tolerance of extremism; plans, which allow restricting activities of those attempting to radicalize others, closing facilities used to promote jihad and updating laws regarding communication record retention, have critics worried measures will drive radicals underground and impinge civil liberties.
lead_paragraph: The British prime minister revealed new proposals that could restrict the activities of those thought to be radicalizing people and close buildings being used to promote jihad.

headline.main: David Cameron Seeks New Powers to Combat Extremism in Britain
headline.print_headline: Citing Extremist Threat, British Premier Seeks New Powers
